Currently clocks ‘go back’ in October and are readjusted in March.  In November to February, early light is needed for safety - work and school.
In February the mornings become lighter naturally. If we re-adjust to BST in the last weekend of February instead of late March, it would have no impact upon the early morning issues yet would:
•         Reclaim spring so that March becomes a time for growth releasing a feel good factor
•         Lead to an immense boost for the economy as people find that they can go out  to 7pm to shop and visit restaurants
•         Cut crime as the built environment become a lighter, active place
•         Make road travel safer and more frequent increasing fuel sales
•         Save NHS funds as overweight and depressed individuals engage with physical activities
•         Let families spend quality time through a range of activities.

Simplistic - but makes profound and irrefutable sense for 2015 onwards making Britain a brighter place!
